description: Public-facing terminology reference. Maps jargon to plain English with tooltip text.

terms.tooltip: Sybil - a fake or duplicate account created to game rewards
Oracle - an automated system that verifies information from outside the blockchain
Multi-oracle - verified by multiple independent data sources
DEX (Decentralized Exchange) - a trading platform where you swap tokens directly, no middleman
DeFi (Decentralized Finance) - financial tools built on blockchain that anyone can use
LP (Liquidity Provider) - someone who deposits tokens into a trading pool and earns fees
CPI (Combined Progression Index) - a trust score based on wallet behavior
CPI-253 (Combined Progression Index) - 253-point wallet behavior score
Tokenomics - how a token's supply, fees, and distribution are designed
On-chain - recorded permanently on the blockchain where anyone can verify it
ERC-8004 - an Ethereum standard that gives AI agents a verifiable identity
x402 - a protocol for micropayments where AI systems pay per API call
DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) - community-run governance where token holders vote
Hardstake - lock your tokens for a fixed period to earn higher rewards
MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) - when someone reorders transactions to profit at your expense
Smart contract - a program on the blockchain that runs automatically when conditions are met
Merkle proof - a mathematical proof that data exists in a set without revealing the full set
Ethervista - the trading platform where BONZI and VISTA tokens are traded
Euler distribution - a mathematical formula that splits trading fees fairly among holders
Impermanent loss - temporary reduction in value when token prices change while your funds are in a pool
A2A (Agent-to-Agent) - AI systems communicating directly with each other
EMA (Exponential Moving Average) - a calculation that weights recent activity more heavily
ACF (Agentic Cooperation Framework) - rules for how AI agents cooperate and make decisions
SINAPI - Brazil's national index for construction costs, published monthly by the government
RWA (Real World Asset) - a physical asset like property represented as a token on the blockchain
EigenTrust - a reputation algorithm where trust scores are based on how trusted your endorsers are
Whale - someone who holds a very large amount of tokens
Seed phrase - a set of 12 or 24 words that recovers your wallet if you lose access

replacement_guide.description: When writing new copy, use 'plain' column. Wrap first occurrence per section with tooltip span.
